As your baby begins to digest 
milk, the stools will change. 
They will become more yellow 
or orange and can be quite 
bright in colour. Breastfed 
babies have quite runny stools. 
Formula-fed babiesâ€™ stools are 
firmer	and	smell	more.
Babies vary a lot in how often 
they pass stools. Some have a 
bowel movement at or around 
each feed; some can go for 
several days without having 
a movement. Either can be 
normal, but most breastfed 
babies produce at least one 
stool	a	day	fo
